doc.str: System for activated sludge wastewater treatment with high dissolved oxygen levels

An activated sludge wastewater treatment system is provided. The disclosed system includes: an uncovered activated sludge basin; a high purity oxygen aeration system; a secondary clarifier; a return activated sludge line and a waste activated sludge line; wherein the system operates at a solids loading of between about 3000 mg and about 10000 mg of suspended solids per liter of mixed liquor; a dissolved oxygen level in the aeration basin in the range of between about 5 mg to 15 mg; and a solids retention time of between about 7 days and 40 days.

"Wastewater Technologies, two oxygenation aeration options--both proven superior, simple and compact", pp. 1-5, Air Liquide Industrial U.S. LP [www.us.airliquide.com]. cited by other . | Marston, K.R., et al., "Five-Day Biochemical Oxygen Demand Removal From Rendering Plant Wastewater", Proceedings of the 37.sup.th Industrial Waste Conference May 11, 12 and 13, 1982, Purdue University, West Lafayette, Indiana. cited by other . | Perez-Elvira, et al., "Sludge minimization technologies," Reviews in Environmental Science and Bio/Technology (2006) 5:375-398. cited by other . | Yoon, et al., "The optimum operational condition of membrane bioreactor (MBR): cost estimation of aeration and sludge treatment", Water Research 38, pp. 37-46 (2004). cited by other. | Roxburgh, et al., "Sludge Minimization Technologies- Doing More to Get Less", WEFTEC (2006), pp. 506-525, Water Environment Foundation. cited by other . | Equipment Spec, "The Vitox System", BOC Gases, The BOD Group 1998. cited by other . | McWhirter, et al., "The Use of High-Purity Oxygen in the Activated Sludge Process", vols. 1, Chapters 1-3, CRC Press, West Palm Beach, Florida (1978). cited by other . | Moran, et al., "High Purity Oxygen Biological Nutrient Removal (BNR)", WEFTEC 2000, Water Environmental Federation. cited by other . | Abbassi, B. et al., "Minimization of Excess Sludge Production by Increase of Oxygen Concentration in Activated Sludge Flocs;
